pages.title: Villager Wrangling
pages.text: To make transporting them less of an absolute pain, $(thing)Villagers/$ will now follow the player while they are holding an $(item)Emerald Block/$ like $(thing)Animals/$ do with food.

pages.title: Demand
pages.text: Villagers will now more appropriately respond to $(thing)Supply/$ and $(thing)Demand/$. In vanilla, $(thing)Demand/$ has no cap on how low it can go, and as such, over time, trades will have such low negative $(thing)Demand/$ that it becomes a non-factor. In $(thing)CreatePunk/$, $(thing)Demand/$ now has a cap on how negative it can be, allowing for trades to increase in price when used repeatedly.

pages.title: Discounts and Curing
pages.text: Trade discounts are capped at $(bold)50%/$, and cannot go any lower. Furthermore, curing a $(thing)Zombie Villager/$ will no longer apply any discount.$(br2)However, if any of your $(thing)Villagers/$ do manage to get turned into $(thing)Zombies/$, they will always convert, regardless of the game's $(thing)Difficulty/$, allowing you to convert them back.
